description.para: Resets a device and its account to the known default settings. This clears all information and settings set by previous users in the following ways: - Bluetooth - This unpairs all bluetooth devices paired with your echo device. - Volume - This resets the echo device's volume to the default value. - Notifications - This clears all notifications from your echo device. - Lists - This clears all to-do items from your echo device. - Settings - This internally syncs the room's profile (if the device is assigned to a room), contacts, address books, delegation access for account linking, and communications (if enabled on the room profile).
The ARN of the device to sync. Required.
Request structure to start the device sync. Required.

description.para:
Lists all categories in the Alexa skill store.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

The maximum number of categories returned, per paginated calls.
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned. If a value for this parameter is not specified the cmdlet will use a default value of '10'.

The tokens used for pagination.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'CategoryList'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.ListSkillsStoreCategoriesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.ListSkillsStoreCategoriesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
The current password of the Wi-Fi network.
Detailed information about a device's network profile.
The name of the network profile associated with a device.
The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the password of the network changes to NextPassword.
The root certificate(s) of your authentication server that will be installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server during EAP negotiation.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.UpdateNetworkProfileResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the NetworkProfileArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^NetworkProfileArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The ARN of the Private Certificate Authority (PCA) created in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM). This is used to issue certificates to the devices.
The current password of the Wi-Fi network.
Detailed information about a device's network profile.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The ARN of the network profile associated with a device.
The name of the network profile associated with a device.
The next, or subsequent, password of the Wi-Fi network. This password is asynchronously transmitted to the device and is used when the password of the network changes to NextPassword.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the NetworkProfileArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^NetworkProfileArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.UpdateNetworkProfileResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The root certificate(s) of your authentication server that will be installed on your devices and used to trust your authentication server during EAP negotiation.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.UpdateNetworkProfileResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Updates room skill parameter details by room, skill, and parameter key ID. Not all skills have a room skill parameter.
The updated room skill parameter. Required.
The ARN of the room associated with the room skill parameter. Required.
The ARN of the skill associated with the room skill parameter. Required.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.PutRoomSkillParameterResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomSkillParameter parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomSkillParameter' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomSkillParameter parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomSkillParameter' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The ARN of the room associated with the room skill parameter. Required.
The updated room skill parameter. Required.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.PutRoomSkillParameterResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The ARN of the skill associated with the room skill parameter. Required.

description.para: Creates a new room profile with the specified details.
The name of a room profile.
The valid address for the room.
The user-specified token that is used during the creation of a profile.
The distance unit to be used by devices in the profile.
Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
Whether an end of meeting reminder is enabled or not.
Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
Whether require check in is enabled or not.
The locale of the room profile. (This is currently only available to a limited preview audience.)
The maximum volume limit for a room profile.
Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not checked into.
A range of 3 to 15 minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
The type of sound that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
Whether room profile setup is enabled.
The temperature unit to be used by devices in the profile.
The time zone used by a room profile.
A wake word for Alexa, Echo, Amazon, or a computer.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ProfileArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.CreateProfileResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.CreateProfileResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The valid address for the room.
The user-specified token that is used during the creation of a profile.
The distance unit to be used by devices in the profile.
Whether an end of meeting reminder is enabled or not.
A range of 3 to 15 minutes that determines when the reminder begins.
The type of sound that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
The locale of the room profile. (This is currently only available to a limited preview audience.)
The maximum volume limit for a room profile.
Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
The name of a room profile.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
Whether require check in is enabled or not.
Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not checked into.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ProfileArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.CreateProfileResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.CreateProfileResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Whether room profile setup is enabled.
The temperature unit to be used by devices in the profile.
The time zone used by a room profile.
A wake word for Alexa, Echo, Amazon, or a computer.

This cmdlet returns a System.String object. The service call response (type Amazon.AlexaForBusiness.Model.CreateProfileResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Updates an existing room profile by room profile ARN.
The updated name for the room profile.
The updated address for the room profile.
The updated distance unit for the room profile.
Duration between 15 and 240 minutes at increments of 15 that determines how long to book an available room when a meeting is started with Alexa.
Whether an end of meeting reminder is enabled or not.
Whether instant booking is enabled or not.
Whether require check in is enabled or not.
Sets the profile as default if selected. If this is missing, no update is done to the default status.
The updated locale for the room profile. (This is currently only available to a limited preview audience.)
The updated maximum volume limit for the room profile.
The ARN of the room profile to update. Required.
Whether the PSTN setting of the room profile is enabled.
Duration between 5 and 20 minutes to determine when to release the room if it's not checked into.
Updates settings for the end of meeting reminder feature that are applied to a room profile. The end of meeting reminder enables Alexa to remind users when a meeting is ending.
The type of sound that users hear during the end of meeting reminder.
Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
Whether the setup mode of the profile is enabled.
The updated temperature unit for the room profile.
The updated timezone for the room profile.
The updated wake word for the room profile.

The updated locale for the room profile. (This is currently only available to a limited preview audience.)

Whether room utilization metrics are enabled or not.
The updated name for the room profile.
